<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>

<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_shmem_register_generic:

int metal_shmem_register_generic(struct metal_generic_shmem *shmem)
{
	/* Make sure that we can be found. */
	metal_assert(shmem->name && strlen(shmem->name) != 0);

	/* Statically registered shmem regions cannot have a destructor. */
	metal_assert(!shmem->io.ops.close);

	metal_list_add_tail(&_metal.common.generic_shmem_list,
			    &shmem->node);
	return 0;
}

explanation: No controlling expressions (if, while, for, do-while, switch) are present in metal_shmem_register_generic. The only expressions are function/macro calls (metal_assert(...), metal_list_add_tail(...)) and a return statement. The metal_assert macro is a simple alias to metal_sys_assert(cond) per the provided definition, not a loop with an invariant controlling expression; even if an assert macro used a do { ... } while (0) pattern, that pattern is an allowed exception (a do-while with an essentially Boolean constant false controlling expression). Therefore there are no invariant controlling expressions requiring investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3.
